comments.body: @nikhiljindal do you know where is the docversionselector.html?
Oh, never mind. I misunderstood it.
@bgrant0607 @nikhiljindal @janetkuo, maybe we can merge this dropdown menu without other changes in this PR, so the sitemap tool will include v1.1 and users are still guided to v1.0 by default?
SGTM. Will you create a PR?
If sitemap generator still ignores v1.1 links we have this #16606
this adds new _v1.1 content into the build and specifies what version of the nav menus to use per "collection" (ie _v1.0 or _v1.1)
consolidated both popstate and click behavior into this function
here is where we check for anchors and scroll

add the "isAnchor" attribute to stop anchors from toggling parent containers in the nav

i wont call them out but you'll also see this attribute added in two other places below
i also consolidated this behavior into a single function (changed nothing but moved two similar instances of this code into one function)
Change this from window.location.pathname to window.location.href (to find absolute URLs instead of just the suffix - result of difference in local build config)

I confirm this does highlight the current page in the nav bar, so progress. LGTM A few issues still: It closes and opens menu items on each back-and-forth, even if that sub-menu was already open. Sometimes back-button does not refresh the page. 1) load http://richieescarez.github.io/kubernetes/v1.0/docs/user-guide/secrets.html 2) Click annotations in the left bar 3) click back-button On Fri, Jul 31, 2015 at 12:17 PM, RichieEscarez notifications@github.com wrote: > In _layouts/docwithnav.html > https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/12092#discussion_r36006962 > : > > > @@ -12,21 +12,38 @@ > > {% include documentation.html %} > > > >
